title: How to Make Eggs in Cream Sauce

steps.headline: Prepare hard boiled eggs.
steps.description: Plan to add 4 eggs to simmering water and simmer for about 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Immediately cool the eggs by running cool water into the pan with cooked eggs.
steps.description: You can also finishing cooling the eggs by adding ice cubes to the cool water. Let eggs cool.

steps.headline: Slice the eggs lengthwise into quarters.
steps.description: You can also use an egg slicer to make thin slices, if desired. Either way slice the eggs and set aside.

steps.headline: In a small saucepan heat 1 can of cream of mushroom soup, condensed, until bubbly.
Season the soup well with salt and pepper.
steps.description: The addition of curry powder may also be added to the soup, if desired.

steps.headline: Add the cooked eggs and stir gently.
Serve over buttered toast slices, cooked rice or warm buttered biscuits.
steps.description: Serves 2 to 4 people, depending on appetites.

text: Prepare hard boiled eggs. Plan to add 4 eggs to simmering water and simmer for about 20 minutes. Immediately cool the eggs by running cool water into the pan with cooked eggs. You can also finishing cooling the eggs by adding ice cubes to the cool water. Let eggs cool. Peel hard cooked eggs.  Slice the eggs lengthwise into quarters. You can also use an egg slicer to make thin slices, if desired. Either way slice the eggs and set aside. In a small saucepan heat 1 can of cream of mushroom soup, condensed, until bubbly.  Season the soup well with salt and pepper. The addition of curry powder may also be added to the soup, if desired. Add the cooked eggs and stir gently.  Heat through.  Serve over buttered toast slices, cooked rice or warm buttered biscuits. Serves 2 to 4 people, depending on appetites.
